claim: This is depicted in Figure 1, which demonstrates the distribution of AAS versus number of articles across all journals.
title: Figure 1.
caption: Distribution of Altmetric attention score across all journals. Figure demonstrates right skewed Altmetric Attention Score distribution.

title: Figure 2.
caption: Scatter plot demonstrating correlation between Altmetric attention score and number of citations across all journals. Line represents line of best fit.

claim: The correlation of individual journals was also evaluated as demonstrated in Figure 3.
title: Figure 3.
caption: Scatter plot demonstrating correlation between Altmetric attention score and number of citations of each individual journal. Line represents line of best fit.

claim: Line represents line of best fit.Figure 3.
title: Figure 3.
caption: Scatter plot demonstrating correlation between Altmetric attention score and number of citations of each individual journal. Line represents line of best fit.

claim: A statistically significant very weak positive correlation was observed between number of citations and Twitter activity (r = 0.2, P < .001) and a statistically significant strong correlation was seen between Twitter activity and AAS (r = 0.77, P < .001) as demonstrated in Figure 4.
title: Figure 4.
caption: (A) Scatter plot demonstrating correlation between Altmetric attention score and twitter activity, (B) Scatter plot demonstrating correlation between number of citations and twitter activity.
